docs.snippet: In the 1890's Edward Burne-Jones was considered the greatest living English artist. He was besieged by admirers and had to turn visitors away. But one day he saw from his window a young man with a portfolio and a young woman with red hair. Because...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the 1890's Edward Burne-Jones was considered the greatest living English artist. He was besieged by admirers and had to turn visitors away. But one day he saw from his window a young man with a portfolio and a young woman with red hair. Because of the hair he admitted the couple--Aubrey Beardsley and his sister Mabel. He took one look at the young man's drawings and said, "You will be a great artist."
docs.abstract: Clark, Kenneth (Sir): The Best of Aubrey Beardsley revd (S)

docs.snippet: DESPITE the headlines about Cuban involvement in Africa, the Fidel Castro interviews on  prime-time television and the rave reviews for the Cuban National Ballet, Americans know very little about the socialist society only 48 miles from Key West. ...
docs.lead_paragraph: DESPITE the headlines about Cuban involvement in Africa, the Fidel Castro interviews on prime-time television and the rave reviews for the Cuban National Ballet, Americans know very little about the socialist society only 48 miles from Key West. Years of mutual hostility and isolation have perpetuated myths and misperceptions on both sides of the Florida Straits.
